name: Semiconductor Manufacturing Process
description: Sub-sector template for semiconductor manufacturing patents (CPC H01L21*) including etching, deposition, and doping.
contextDescription: Manufacturing process patents cover wafer fabrication steps. Key areas include plasma etching (RIE, ALE), thin film deposition (CVD, ALD, PVD), ion implantation, CMP, and cleaning. High-value targets include equipment vendors (Applied Materials, Lam Research, ASML, Tokyo Electron) and foundries. Process patents can be essential for node transitions.
scoringGuidance: Atomic layer processes (ALD, ALE) are essential for advanced nodes.
High-aspect-ratio etching is critical for 3D NAND and DRAM.
Selective deposition patents reduce patterning steps.
Equipment-agnostic process patents have broader applicability.

questions.question: What manufacturing process does this patent cover (etch, deposition, implant, CMP, clean)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the process type and its criticality to manufacturing.

questions.question: Does this target specific equipment vendors (Applied, Lam, TEL, ASML)? Or is it equipment-agnostic?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Equipment-specific patents may target fewer infringers but can be essential.

questions.question: Is this process relevant to advanced nodes (sub-10nm)? Score higher for EUV or atomic-scale processes.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Advanced node processes are high-value with fewer alternatives.

questions.question: Does this patent improve manufacturing yield or reduce defects? Yield patents are highly valuable.
